com.here.android.mpa.search

Class DiscoveryRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.search.Request<DiscoveryResultPage>
      • com.here.android.mpa.search.DiscoveryRequest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AroundRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, SearchRequest

    public class DiscoveryRequest
extends Request<DiscoveryResultPage>
    Represents an extended Request used to retrieve a DiscoveryResultPage object by way of Places search services.
    See Also:
    ExploreRequest, HereRequest, SearchRequest

      • setRichTextFormatting

        public DiscoveryRequest setRichTextFormatting(RichTextFormatting value)
        Sets a RichTextFormatting to be used in request responses. The default formatting is RichTextFormatting.HTML.
        Parameters:
        value - Desired RichTextFormatting
        Returns:
        This DiscoveryRequest object

      • getCollectionSize

        public int getCollectionSize()
        Gets the current collection size being used for request responses.
        Overrides:
        getCollectionSize in class Request<DiscoveryResultPage>
        Returns:
        The current response collection size
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextSuggestionRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest, GeocodeRequest

      • setCollectionSize

        public DiscoveryRequest setCollectionSize(int value)
        Sets a collection size to be used for request responses. The maximum number of result items in each collection will be limited to this value. The valid value range is [1..100]. The default collection size is 20.
        Overrides:
        setCollectionSize in class Request<DiscoveryResultPage>
        Parameters:
        value - Desired response collection size per request.
        Returns:
        This Request object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is out of range.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextSuggestionRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest, GeocodeRequest

      • addReference

        public DiscoveryRequest addReference(java.lang.String name)
        This function adds the name of a requested reference identifiers to be returned in the results.

        For example, to retrieve an POI identifier (pvid), set this value to Request.PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME.

        Overrides:
        addReference in class Request<DiscoveryResultPage>
        Parameters:
        name - Name of reference identifier to retrieve.
        Returns:
        True if name added, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        http://places.hybrid.api.here.com/places/static/doc/public/#topics/external-references.html, Request#PVID_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request#VENUES_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request#VENUES_CONTENT_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request#VENUES_DESTINATION_ID_REFERENCE_NAME, Request#VENUES_VENUE_ID_REFERENCE_NAME

      • getReferences

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getReferences()
        This function returns the names of requested reference identifiers to be returned in the results.
        Overrides:
        getReferences in class Request<DiscoveryResultPage>
        Returns:
        List of the names of reference identifiers to be returned in the result.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, PlaceRequest

      • setMapViewport

        public DiscoveryRequest setMapViewport(GeoBoundingBox mapViewport)
        The map viewport is a bounding box of the map area currently visible to the user. The viewport can act as an implicit location context in the absence of an explicit location context. To ensure you get the best results possible, you should always set a viewport if there is a map visible to the user.
        Overrides:
        setMapViewport in class Request<DiscoveryResultPage>
        Parameters:
        mapViewport - The bounding box of the map area currently visible.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextSuggestionRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest, GeocodeRequest

      • addImageDimensions

        public void addImageDimensions(int width,
                      int height)
        Request Image Media with specific dimensions. At least one of the sizes (width or height) needs to be valid (greater than 0).
        Parameters:
        width - Image width (pass 0 for any width)
        height - Image height (pass 0 for any height)
